name: Hard Cuisine of Scotland Quiz / Test | International Cuisine | 10 Questions

questions.text: What type of fish is used for Arbroath Smokies?
questions.explanation:
Haddock.

	Arbroath Smokies are actually produced in the village of Auchmithie, three miles from Arbroath. The haddock are salted overnight, then smoked over a wood fire.

questions.text: Scotch Broth is a traditional Scottish soup, made with various vegetables and which type of grain?
questions.explanation:
Barley.

	Scotch Broth was traditionally made with mutton as a stock, although chicken stock cubes are more usually used nowadays. The most common vegetables included are carrots and turnips.

questions.text: Scotland's national dish of haggis consists of the heart, liver and lungs of which animal, along with oatmeal and spices?
questions.explanation:
Sheep.

	Haggis is traditionally served alongside potatoes and neeps (turnip or swede), as this was supposedly the favourite dish of the poet Robert Burns.

questions.text: Cullen Skink is a soup made with which main ingredient?
questions.explanation:
Haddock.

	"Finnan Haddie" is a smoked haddock from the village of Findon, and is the main ingredient of Cullen Skink, along with onions and potatoes.

questions.text: A Scotch Pie is a traditional lunchtime snack containing what type of meat?
questions.explanation:
Mutton.

	Originally called Tuppenny Pies, because they cost two pennies, Scotch Pies are especially popular at soccer matches in Scotland, where they are regarded as a half-time "delicacy", alongside a cup of Bovril!

questions.text: What type of cuisine is Crowdie?
questions.explanation:
Cheese.

	Crowdie is a cream cheese, originally introduced to Scotland by the Vikings, and sold rolled in oatmeal.

questions.text: A bannock is a type of scone traditionally made in which Borders town?
questions.explanation:
Selkirk.

	Bannocks have been made in Selkirk since 1859, and are made with wheatflour and dried fruit.

questions.text: What vegetable is the main ingredient of Stovies?
questions.explanation:
Potato.

	Stovies are one of the most popular meals in Scotland, especially on a cold day. Recipes tend to vary from area to area, but the main ingredients tend to be sliced potatoes, onions and left-over meat.

questions.text: A bridie is a type of meat pie associated with which Scottish town?
questions.explanation:
Forfar.

	A bridie is similair in appearance to a Cornish pasty, but doesn't contain potatoes, just minced beef and onions.

questions.text: What name is given to a traditional dish from the Scottish Borders consisting of mixed and mashed vegetables such as potatoes and cabbage, topped with melted cheese?
questions.explanation:
Rumbledethumps.

	Colcannon is a traditional Irish dish, bubble and squeak is English, and kailkenny is from Aberdeenshire; none of these is traditionally served with melted cheese.
